message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of entropy estimation, which is a fundamental problem in information theory and machine learning. The paper uses techniques from approximation theory and statistical inference to analyze the performance of the Dirichlet prior smoothed plug-in entropy estimator. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). However, the paper also uses techniques from machine learning and statistics, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.ST (Statistics) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also deals with discrete distributions, which makes cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the interplay between bias analysis and approximation theory, which makes cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.MM (Multimedia) possible sub-categories as well.
